title: Chord: 13th in D# (Shape: G)
content:
# Chord: 13th in D# (Shape: G)

## Description
The G 13th chord in the key of D# consists of the notes G, B, D#, F#, and A. With G as the root note, this chord includes the major 7th (F#), major 3rd (B), major 5th (D#), and dominant 13th (A). This creates a jazzy and rich sound that can add color and complexity to your music.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: G
- Major 3rd: B
- Major 5th: D#
- Major 7th: F#
- Dominant 13th: A

## Genre and Flavor
The G 13th chord, particularly in the key of D#, is commonly used in jazz and funk music. It adds a sophisticated and soulful flavor to compositions, providing a sense of tension and release. This chord can create a smooth and laid-back vibe, perfect for creating groovy and mellow music.

## Songs
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis** - This iconic jazz piece features 13th chords throughout, creating a cool and modal sound.
2. **"Pick Up the Pieces" by Average White Band** - A funk classic that makes great use of 13th chords, adding depth to the rhythmic groove.
3. **"Cissy Strut" by The Meters** - This funky instrumental track showcases the use of 13th chords to create a smooth and infectious groove.
